stream_context.summary: Kaze codes and tests the Course 15 boss— a corrupted “pentapose” Yoshi whose tentacles emerge from blue-hole portals— while discussing overall level/boss counts, side-level scope, and platform/porting ideas.

development_findings.summary: Course 15’s boss is a five-armed, corrupted Yoshi (‘pentapose’) whose tentacles emerge from blue portals; players must destroy ‘tumor’ weak-spots on tentacles, then on his nose, to heal him and win the fight.
development_findings.quote: You jump on the tentacle, you destroy the ward, and then Yoshi gets weak … you punch the ward on his nose and that’s dealing damage to him.

development_findings.summary: Tentacles use spline hit-boxes; Kaze added collision, camera shake, damage logic, retract-on-hit behavior, and adjustable joint sizes for smoother gameplay.
development_findings.quote: We need to write out the position of the tentacle, render the ward, and then use spline hitboxes to figure out where the tentacle hitboxes are.

development_findings.summary: Visual telegraphing: each portal spawns a light cone so players can see attacks from any angle; Kaze iterated on size, opacity, and timing to balance readability and noise.
development_findings.quote: At least now it's pretty consistently possible to dodge his attacks … we needed this light so you can tell what's going on.

development_findings.summary: Difficulty will scale by speeding up animations and allowing 2-3 simultaneous tentacle attacks in later phases.
Boss text boxes will contain encrypted messages; Kaze has two encryption techniques in mind and wants more.
development_findings.quote: I’m thinking for the Yoshi boss here we’re actually using some cryptographic messages that we send the player through his text boxes.

development_findings.summary: Current plan: 9 boss fights across the 15 main courses; Kaze listed which courses have or lack bosses.
development_findings.quote: We have eight boss fights, nine boss fights in the main courses. That’s actually kind of a lot.

development_findings.summary: Side-level scope expanded from 6 to about 9 (including the four cap levels).
development_findings.quote: Nowadays there's a good chance that it's actually going to be like nine side levels.

development_findings.summary: Courses 13 & 14 are ~95 % complete; Course 13 still needs its outside area, Course 14 awaits final visual polish.
development_findings.quote: 13 is missing the outside area—Zeina wanted to work on that … course 14 is done but a lot of the visuals are left for Violet to do.

development_findings.summary: New inexpensive reflective-surface shader was co-developed with community member Akumoid and applied to a building model; similar work is planned for the rocket.
development_findings.quote: Together we came up with this one here … and it looks so cool. And it’s a super cheap effect too.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is considering using YSK static recompilation for a native Android/ multiplatform build, eliminating emulator dependence.
development_findings.quote: I might legitimately just use YSK static recompilation to properly import the game to like everything at once.

context_findings.summary: Kaze deliberately avoids political statements to preserve broad audience goodwill, citing the ‘halo effect’.
context_findings.quote: If no one knows what my political beliefs are then people are more likely to assume my political beliefs overlap with theirs and they will like me for it.

context_findings.summary: He is annoyed by repeated polite ‘how are you?’ questions during streams.
context_findings.quote: How are you doing—that’s like my least favorite question … it’s people being polite but it’s also pissing me off.

context_findings.summary: Mentions fascination with ‘aura-maxing’ concept after watching Django Unchained twice.
Open to community ports but refuses to expend time on them; only endorses efforts that succeed without his help.
context_findings.quote: If you can do it on yourself without my help you can do with my hacks whatever you want, but as soon as you start asking me for help I'm gonna be annoyed.

biobak.summary: Will remake the final pentapose Yoshi model; Kaze’s placeholder model serves as concept guidance.
biobak.quote: They're more like a symbolic representation … so that when Biobak remakes my model, he knows what I was going for.

badub.summary: Composer’s music appeared on SoundCloud; chat joked that ‘Badub is royalty now’.

zeina.summary: Responsible for Course 13’s outside area; work has been in progress ‘for a long time’.
zeina.quote: 13 is missing the outside area—Zeina wanted to work on that—she's been working on it for a long time now.

key_stories.title: Prototyping the Pentapose Boss
key_stories.summary: Across the stream Kaze goes from concept to a working prototype: tentacle spawning, collision, damage logic, visual telegraphing, and balancing.
key_stories.challenge: Create an engaging, readable boss fight inside N64 limits.
key_stories.process: Implemented spline hitboxes, retract logic, camera shake, portal lights, scaled animations, and placeholder graphics.
key_stories.outcome: Prototype is functional; next steps are additional attack patterns and final art.
key_stories.key_quote: This feels good. And he's also going to need to be able to attack multiple times at the same time.

key_stories.title: Community Shader Collaboration
key_stories.summary: Fan developer Akumoid DM’d Kaze about N64 shaders; together they produced a cheap reflection effect now applied to in-game architecture.
key_stories.challenge: Achieve modern-looking reflections within strict N64 performance limits.
key_stories.process: Iterative DM collaboration, custom reflection mask separate from base texture.
key_stories.outcome: High-quality, low-cost shader implemented; rocket model next.
key_stories.key_quote: You’d think this is expensive, but this is literally free.

key_stories.title: Evaluating Fan PC Ports
key_stories.summary: Kaze examined community attempts to port his earlier hack Peach’s Fury into SM64 Co-Op Deluxe.
key_stories.challenge: Fan ports often break custom mechanics and graphics.
key_stories.process: Reviewed videos, pointed out missing water, backgrounds, carousel, wrong collisions; acknowledged improvements in newer build.
key_stories.outcome: Still views current ports as rough and won’t assist; highlights complexity of porting his highly customized code.
key_stories.key_quote: I doubt they would even get close to getting it right because there's so much custom code.
